content:
Hi, this PR has been put on the maintainer queue (a bit less than, actually) two weeks ago now. Would it be possible to merge it?
More generally, the pace of mathlib3 PRs inclusion seems to have slowed down to a halt (at least my PRs): is that just that all effort is now on the port? Would making the PRs to mathlib4 when possible make them move faster? Thanks!

If you are making PRs for new material (in new files) and you only need things that are already ported then my suggestion would be to PR directly to mathlib4.

Of course, the PR you mentioned should just be merged.

And yes, I think the vast majority of maintainer/reviewer effort is on porting.

Thanks! Most files I'm working on have relatively few dependencies, but I think actually all my PRs touch some existing files, which I guess makes "pure mathlib4" PRs impossible for the time being, then.
